means: 可感觉[感受]到的，可理解的，可认识的

sentence.Network_en: Pasternak gave him a barely perceptible smile.
sentence.Network_cn: 帕斯特纳克给了他一个几乎无法察觉的微笑。

sentence.Network_en: The price increase has had no perceptible effect on sales.
sentence.Network_cn: 这次提价没有对销售产生明显的影响。

sentence.Network_en: The difference is scarcely perceptible to the average reader.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种差别一般读者几乎是察觉不到的.

PerfectNetExp.abs: percept 知觉对象perceptible 可察觉的perceptibly 可察觉
percentage of modulation 灯度perceptible 易感的perched block 坡栖岩块
2012年7月16日 - Though表示让步转折,所以空格 2 应该体现和"可以感觉得到的(perceptible)"意思相反,但是不能矛盾的含义,所以空格 2 应该体现"不明显,不强烈"的含义。.
perceptibility 感觉力；理解力perceptible 可观测得的perception 感觉；知觉；感性认识；观念；理解力；接收.

list.abs: perambulating ulcer 崩蚀性溃疡perceptibility 感觉力perceptive deafness 知觉性聋
知觉（percePtion ）为较复杂的感受，是一事物的各种不同属性反映到脑中进行综合，并结合以往经验，在脑中得到整体印象。当我 …
感知（perception）（Perception）：影响法术攻击时的命中率和治疗法术能成功愈合伤口的几率。智慧（Wisdom）：影响目标抵抗你法术的伤害值 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin perceptibilis, from Latin percipere 'seize, understand' (see perceive)

entry.def: Something that is perceptible can only just be seen or noticed.

example.ex: Pasternak gave him a barely perceptible smile...
example.tran: 帕斯特纳克给了他一个几乎无法察觉的微笑。

example.ex: There was a slight but perceptible air of neglect.
example.tran: 有一种微弱但可察觉的冷落意味。

means.word_mean: 1. capable of being perceived by the mind or senses;
2. easily perceived by the senses or grasped by the mind;

sentences.sentence: "a perceptible sense of expectation in the court"

auth_sentence.content: Perceptible slackening of the taut muscles of his mouth.
auth_sentence.res_content: Perceptible slackening of the taut muscles of his mouth.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Perceptible slackening of the taut muscles of his mouth.

auth_sentence.content: It is perceptible only at the galactic cluster level.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is perceptible only at the galactic cluster level.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is perceptible only at the galactic cluster level.

auth_sentence.content: Without motion, neither light nor sound would be perceptible.
auth_sentence.res_content: Without motion, neither light nor sound would be perceptible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Without motion, neither light nor sound would be perceptible.

means.word_mean: 可感觉〔感受〕到的,可理解的,可认识的

sentences.cn: 听他声音可以觉得出他发怒了

sentences.en: a clearly perceptible decline in public confidence
sentences.cn: 可清楚感觉到的公众信心的下降
可以觉得出气温下降了

sentences.en: His lips curved in a barely perceptible smile.
sentences.cn: 他的嘴角弯了弯，露出一丝几乎察觉不到的笑容。

sentences.en: The difference is scarcely perceptible to the average reader.
sentences.cn: 这种差别一般读者几乎是察觉不到的。
